questions.text: Public investment in education and job training should increase even if it raises near-term taxes.
Balanced budgets should be prioritized even when the economy slows.
Individual rights on social issues should be broadly protected from government interference.
Community standards should take precedence over individual preferences on key social issues.
Government transparency and anti-corruption rules should expand, even if compliance adds cost.
Independent institutions (courts, auditors) should have stronger powers to check leaders.
Civic participation (voting, meetings, volunteering) should be expected of all residents.
Youth should have structured opportunities to deliberate and propose local policy ideas.
